intro: Oxyspora caudata, commonly known as the trailing oxyspora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy foliage and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually small, greenish-white to reddish in color, and it produces small, dry fruits known as utricles. Oxyspora caudata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
